documents.title: Summary of Benefits and Coverage (SBC) - Anthem PPO Gold Plan 2024
documents.description: Comprehensive 47-page summary of benefits, coverage, and costs for PPO Gold plan including detailed cost-sharing, network information, and coverage limitations

sections.title: Plan Overview
paragraphs: This Summary of Benefits and Coverage (SBC) provides a brief overview of your Anthem PPO Gold plan. It highlights key features such as deductibles, copayments, and coinsurance. For complete details, please refer to your Certificate of Coverage.

Effective Date: January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024. This plan is designed to provide comprehensive healthcare coverage with flexibility to see any provider, though you save money when you use in-network providers.

Your Anthem PPO Gold plan offers extensive coverage for medical, prescription drug, and mental health services. The plan includes preventive care at no cost, comprehensive prescription drug coverage, and access to a nationwide network of healthcare providers.
list: Plan Name: Anthem PPO Gold Plan
Coverage Area: Massachusetts and surrounding states

sections.title: Deductibles and Out-of-Pocket Maximums
paragraphs: Your deductible is the amount you pay for covered health care services before your plan starts to pay. Your out-of-pocket maximum is the most you have to pay for covered services in a plan year.

The individual deductible is $1,200 and the family deductible is $2,400. Once you meet your deductible, you pay copayments or coinsurance for covered services. Your out-of-pocket maximum protects you from excessive costs - once you reach $5,000 in out-of-pocket costs for an individual or $10,000 for a family, the plan pays 100% of covered services for the rest of the year.

sections.title: Copayments and Coinsurance
paragraphs: Copayments are fixed amounts you pay for covered services. Coinsurance is your share of the cost of a covered health care service, calculated as a percentage of the allowed amount for the service.

Your plan includes copayments for most services, which means you pay a fixed amount and the plan pays the rest. For services that require coinsurance, you pay a percentage of the allowed amount after meeting your deductible.

sections.title: Prescription Drug Coverage
paragraphs: Your plan includes comprehensive prescription drug coverage. Costs vary by drug tier, with generic medications typically costing less than brand-name drugs.
You can fill prescriptions at any in-network pharmacy, including retail pharmacies, mail-order pharmacies, and specialty pharmacies for complex medications.

sections.title: Preventive Care
paragraphs: Preventive care services are covered at 100% with no copayment, deductible, or coinsurance when you use an in-network provider. These services help prevent illness and detect health problems early when they're most treatable.
Covered preventive services include annual physical exams, immunizations, cancer screenings, and other evidence-based preventive care services recommended by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.
list: Annual physical exams and wellness visits
Immunizations and vaccines (flu, COVID-19, HPV, etc.)

sections.title: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Coverage
paragraphs: Your plan provides comprehensive coverage for mental health and substance abuse services, including inpatient and outpatient treatment, counseling, and medication management.
Mental health benefits are provided at the same level as medical benefits, ensuring you have access to the care you need for mental health conditions.
list: Psychiatric care and medication management ($40 copay)

sections.title: Maternity and Newborn Care
paragraphs: Your plan provides comprehensive coverage for maternity care, including prenatal visits, delivery, and postnatal care for both mother and baby.
All maternity-related services are covered as essential health benefits, including labor and delivery, newborn care, and breastfeeding support.
list: Prenatal care visits (no copay for preventive visits)
Labor and delivery (20% coinsurance after deductible)
Complications of pregnancy (covered as medical condition)

sections.title: Emergency and Urgent Care
paragraphs: Your plan provides coverage for emergency and urgent care services. Emergency care is covered even if you're out of your service area, and urgent care provides convenient access to care for non-emergency conditions.
Emergency services are covered at the same level whether you use an in-network or out-of-network provider, ensuring you get the care you need in a medical emergency.
list: Emergency room visits ($200 copay, waived if admitted)
Ambulance services ($100 copay for emergency transport)

sections.title: Prescription Drug Benefits
paragraphs: Your plan includes comprehensive prescription drug coverage through a network of retail pharmacies, mail-order pharmacies, and specialty pharmacies.
You can save money by using generic medications when available, and you can get 90-day supplies of maintenance medications through mail order for additional savings.
list: Retail pharmacy network (CVS, Walgreens, Rite Aid, local pharmacies)
Mail-order pharmacy (90-day supplies for maintenance medications)
Step therapy (may be required for some brand-name drugs)
Quantity limits (for controlled substances and high-cost drugs)

sections.title: Appeals and Grievances
paragraphs: If you disagree with a coverage decision or have a complaint about your plan, you have the right to file an appeal or grievance. The plan provides a fair and timely process for resolving disputes.
You can file an appeal if your claim is denied or if you disagree with a coverage determination. You can file a grievance for any other complaint about your plan or care.
list: Internal appeals process (plan reviews your case)
Grievance process (for complaints about care or service)
Right to request case files and documentation
Right to have a representative assist with appeals

sections.title: Coverage Limitations and Exclusions
paragraphs: While your plan provides comprehensive coverage, there are some services and treatments that are not covered. It's important to understand these limitations to avoid unexpected costs.
Some services may require prior authorization or may have quantity limits. Always check with your plan before receiving non-emergency care to ensure coverage.
list: Weight loss surgery (unless medically necessary and pre-authorized)

sections.title: Network Information
paragraphs: Your plan includes access to a large network of healthcare providers. Using in-network providers will save you money, but you can also see out-of-network providers for a higher cost.
The Anthem PPO Network includes thousands of providers across the country, giving you flexibility to receive care wherever you are.
list: Urgent care centers and walk-in clinics

sections.title: Member Resources and Support
paragraphs: Your plan includes a variety of resources and support services to help you manage your health and make the most of your coverage.
These resources are available 24/7 and can help you find providers, understand your benefits, and get answers to your questions.

sections.title: Important Contact Information
paragraphs: Keep this information handy for when you need to contact your plan, find a provider, or get help with your coverage.
You can reach customer service 24/7 for assistance with your plan, finding providers, or getting answers to your questions.
list: Mobile App: Available for iOS and Android

sections.title: Understanding Your Benefits
paragraphs: This SBC is a summary of your benefits and coverage. For complete details about your plan, including all terms and conditions, please refer to your Certificate of Coverage.
If you have questions about your coverage or need help understanding your benefits, contact customer service or visit the member portal for more information.
list: This SBC is not a complete description of your plan
For complete details, see your Certificate of Coverage
Benefits may change during the plan year
You will be notified of any changes
This SBC is available in other languages
Large print versions are available upon request

sections.title: Cost-Sharing Examples
paragraphs: The following examples show how much you would pay for common medical services under this plan. These examples are based on typical costs and may vary depending on your specific situation.
Remember that you must meet your deductible before the plan starts paying for most services, except for preventive care and some other services.

sections.title: Prior Authorization Requirements
paragraphs: Some services and medications require prior authorization before they can be covered. This means your doctor must get approval from the plan before you receive the service or medication.
Prior authorization helps ensure that services are medically necessary and appropriate for your condition. Your doctor will handle the prior authorization process for you.

sections.title: Step Therapy Requirements
paragraphs: Step therapy means you must try certain medications before the plan will cover a different medication. This is often required for brand-name drugs when generic alternatives are available.
Your doctor will work with the plan to ensure you get the most appropriate medication for your condition while following step therapy requirements.
list: Brand-name drugs when generics are available

sections.title: Quantity Limits
paragraphs: Some medications have quantity limits to ensure safe and appropriate use. These limits are based on medical guidelines and FDA recommendations.
If you need more medication than the quantity limit allows, your doctor can request an exception by providing medical justification.
list: Medications with high cost and limited benefit

sections.title: Coverage for Chronic Conditions
paragraphs: Your plan provides comprehensive coverage for chronic conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, and mental health conditions. This includes medications, supplies, and ongoing care management.
The plan includes disease management programs to help you manage your chronic condition and improve your health outcomes.
list: Mental health conditions (therapy, medications, case management)

sections.title: Coverage for Preventive Services
paragraphs: Preventive services are covered at 100% with no copayment, deductible, or coinsurance when you use an in-network provider. These services help prevent illness and detect health problems early.
The plan covers all preventive services recommended by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force, including screenings, immunizations, and counseling.
list: Annual physical exams and wellness visits

sections.title: Coverage for Emergency Services
paragraphs: Emergency services are covered at the same level whether you use an in-network or out-of-network provider. This ensures you get the care you need in a medical emergency.
Emergency services include treatment for conditions that could reasonably be expected to result in serious jeopardy to your health if not treated immediately.
list: Emergency room visits ($200 copay, waived if admitted)

sections.title: Coverage for Maternity and Newborn Care
paragraphs: Your plan provides comprehensive coverage for maternity care, including prenatal visits, delivery, and postnatal care for both mother and baby.
All maternity-related services are covered as essential health benefits, including labor and delivery, newborn care, and breastfeeding support.
list: Prenatal care visits (no copay for preventive visits)
Labor and delivery (20% coinsurance after deductible)
Complications of pregnancy (covered as medical condition)

sections.title: Coverage for Mental Health and Substance Abuse
paragraphs: Your plan provides comprehensive coverage for mental health and substance abuse services, including inpatient and outpatient treatment, counseling, and medication management.
Mental health benefits are provided at the same level as medical benefits, ensuring you have access to the care you need for mental health conditions.
list: Psychiatric care and medication management ($40 copay)

sections.title: Coverage for Prescription Drugs
paragraphs: Your plan includes comprehensive prescription drug coverage through a network of retail pharmacies, mail-order pharmacies, and specialty pharmacies.
You can save money by using generic medications when available, and you can get 90-day supplies of maintenance medications through mail order for additional savings.
list: Retail pharmacy network (CVS, Walgreens, Rite Aid, local pharmacies)
Mail-order pharmacy (90-day supplies for maintenance medications)
Step therapy (may be required for some brand-name drugs)
Quantity limits (for controlled substances and high-cost drugs)
Specialty medications (25% coinsurance, up to $250 max)

sections.title: Coverage for Durable Medical Equipment
paragraphs: Your plan covers durable medical equipment (DME) that is medically necessary for your condition. This includes equipment like wheelchairs, walkers, and CPAP machines.
DME must be prescribed by your doctor and may require prior authorization. The plan will work with you to find the most appropriate equipment for your needs.

sections.title: Coverage for Home Health Care
paragraphs: Your plan covers home health care services when you need skilled care at home. This includes nursing care, physical therapy, and other services provided by licensed professionals.
Home health care must be ordered by your doctor and provided by a licensed home health agency. The plan will work with you to arrange appropriate care.

sections.title: Coverage for Skilled Nursing Facility Care
paragraphs: Your plan covers skilled nursing facility care when you need 24-hour skilled nursing care after a hospital stay. This includes rehabilitation services and medical care.
Skilled nursing facility care is covered for up to 100 days per benefit period. You must meet certain criteria to qualify for this coverage.
list: Skilled nursing care (up to 100 days per benefit period)

sections.title: Coverage for Hospice Care
paragraphs: Your plan covers hospice care when you have a terminal illness and choose to focus on comfort care rather than curative treatment. This includes medical care, counseling, and support services.
Hospice care is provided by a licensed hospice agency and includes services for both you and your family members.

sections.title: Coverage for Ambulance Services
paragraphs: Your plan covers ambulance services when you need emergency medical transport. This includes ground ambulance and air ambulance when medically necessary.
Ambulance services are covered at the same level whether you use an in-network or out-of-network provider, ensuring you get the care you need in an emergency.

sections.title: Coverage for Diagnostic Imaging
paragraphs: Your plan covers diagnostic imaging services when they are medically necessary. This includes X-rays, CT scans, MRIs, and other imaging studies.
Some imaging services may require prior authorization. Your doctor will work with the plan to ensure you get the imaging you need.
list: MRI scans and magnetic resonance imaging
PET scans and positron emission tomography

sections.title: Coverage for Laboratory Services
paragraphs: Your plan covers laboratory services when they are medically necessary. This includes blood tests, urine tests, and other laboratory studies.
Laboratory services are typically covered with a copayment or coinsurance. Some specialized tests may require prior authorization.

sections.title: Coverage for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation
paragraphs: Your plan covers physical therapy and rehabilitation services when they are medically necessary. This includes physical therapy, occupational therapy, and speech therapy.
Physical therapy services are covered for up to 20 visits per year. Additional visits may require prior authorization.
list: Physical therapy (up to 20 visits per year)

sections.title: Coverage for Chiropractic Care
paragraphs: Your plan covers chiropractic care when it is medically necessary. This includes spinal manipulation and other chiropractic treatments.
Chiropractic care is covered with a copayment and may have visit limits. Your doctor must provide a referral for chiropractic services.
list: Massage therapy and soft tissue work

sections.title: Coverage for Acupuncture
paragraphs: Your plan covers acupuncture when it is medically necessary. This includes traditional Chinese medicine and other acupuncture treatments.
Acupuncture services are covered with a copayment and may have visit limits. Your doctor must provide a referral for acupuncture services.

sections.title: Coverage for Vision Care
paragraphs: Your plan provides limited coverage for vision care services. This includes eye exams and some corrective lenses, but coverage is limited compared to medical services.
Vision care services are covered with a copayment and may have annual limits. You may want to consider a separate vision plan for more comprehensive coverage.

sections.title: Coverage for Dental Care
paragraphs: Your plan provides limited coverage for dental care services. This includes basic dental care and some oral surgery, but coverage is limited compared to medical services.
Dental care services are covered with a copayment and may have annual limits. You may want to consider a separate dental plan for more comprehensive coverage.

sections.title: Coverage for Hearing Care
paragraphs: Your plan provides limited coverage for hearing care services. This includes hearing tests and some hearing aids, but coverage is limited compared to medical services.
Hearing care services are covered with a copayment and may have annual limits. You may want to consider a separate hearing plan for more comprehensive coverage.

sections.title: Coverage for Podiatry Care
paragraphs: Your plan covers podiatry care when it is medically necessary. This includes foot and ankle care, diabetic foot care, and custom orthotics.
Podiatry services are covered with a copayment and may require a referral from your primary care doctor.
list: Physical therapy for foot and ankle
